item.title: Report E-2025050233
item.description:
Report E-2025050233

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 12, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were forked and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallet, and pavement beneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew containerized the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Absorbent pads, granular absorbents, and hand tools were utilized to remove the released paint from the surfaces. The impacted pallet was dismantled. All impacted absorbents and the pallet were containerized in four (4) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050263
item.description:
Report E-2025050263

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PICK UP DRIVER LOADED THE PALLET WITH THE DRUMS IN THE NOSE OF THE TRUCK. THE DRIVER FAILED TO PROPERLY SECURE THE DRUMS. THE DRUMS CONSEQUENTLY FELL OVER IN TRANSIT RESULTING IN THE UNINTENTIONAL RELEASE OF 14GAL OF LIQUID DUE TO A CAP FAILURE. THE SPILLED LIQUID WAS NEUTRALIZED WITH SPILL X POWDER, ABSORBED WITH SPEEDY DRY, AND PLACED IN AN OVERPACK CONTAINER IN PREPARATION FOR DISPOSITION.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: 2 Milwaukee String trimmer kits (3006-22 17" Part No.320345734) with spare batteries (2 boxes of spare batteries in UN 4G/Y4/S/23 CN/C520066 PI:0208. The Class 9 Lithium or Sodium Ion battery hazard label is concealed. The UN 3481 Battery Mark was visible. NO Release. Additional Tracking#167228001740 Concealed DG, Holding for FAA Investigation.

item.title: Report X-2025051803
item.description:
Report X-2025051803

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A three pallet/package shipment was identified as containing undeclared dangerous goods at the FedEx origin station in Jamaica, New York after being transported by surface transport from the station in Newark, New Jersey. When more than two Cordless Robot Pool Cleaners were visible on a single pallet in a consignment of more than two packages, employees noted the lack of 3481 Lithium battery marks on the outer packaging and reported the issue to Dangerous Goods Administration. The shipment was opened to determine the quantities of UN3481 per pallet and audit the contents after it was noted that the Commercial Invoice listed several suspicious entries. Numerous additional UN3481s were discovered along with other undeclared regulated DG contained in the three pallets (flammable aerosols and UN3480s). This shipment has been deemed to be undeclared based on the existence of 2.1s and UN3480s being in this shipment with no indication of their inclusion. The Master Tracking number 880927791184 (and subsidiary tracking numbers 880927791195 and 880927791200) contained a total of 143 inner containers of UN3481, 281 inner containers of flammable aerosol sunscreen, 10 inner containers of flammable aerosol insecticide and 3 stand-alone lithium ion batteries, 1 of which appears to be over 100 watt-hour capacity. The origin station was directed by FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration to hold the shipment pending further disposition instructions.

item.title: Report E-2025050060
item.description:
Report E-2025050060

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: As the forklift driver was loading the trailer, the employee pushed into the pallet behind causing the 5 gallon jerrican lids to fail. The result was seepage out of the lids of 3 jerricans. Upon discovery of the spill, the adhesive that seeped out had already dried. The jerrican was cleaned off using spill pads, inspected to ensure the lid was sealed, and the pallet rewrapped to prepare for transit.
